Sen. @ossoff on clean energy:

"Humanity faces a mighty task right now. We have to adapt to climate change, determine how we're going to keep growing our societies economically w/out destroying our planet. Electric vehicles are a core part of that transition to clean energy." http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1381763511647363072/img/4Tggc6Fbvd2AsJWV.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1381763511647363072/vid/480x270/C6aq61Yy-VgF_s-_.mp4?tag=14

.@shongables: "Thanks to the intervention of a GA Senator, 2,600 jobs will be coming to Jackson County. SK Innovation will operate a plant in Commerce that makes electric batteries for cars, but the future of the plant was in jeopardy...until Dem. Sen. Jon @Ossoff got involved." http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eyzq1FPXIAMIwGN.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1381737106511380483/vid/480x270/FUJs_-soQq3T-o-a.mp4?tag=14

RT @Jake_Best_ COMING UP NEXT: Sen. @ossoff joins @DavidWestin on @BloombergTV to discuss his role in brokering the SK International-LG Energy Solutions deal, saving 2,600 Georgia jobs and billions of dollars of investment. #GAPol http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EyzX3RWXEAkgozn.jpg
@GayleBays @ossoff Hi Gayle, we're so sorry to hear about this delay. Please contact our office, as we'd be happy to help! You can call either 470-786-7800 or 202-224-3521.

"I am appreciative that leadership at both SKI and LGES were willing to communicate daily with me and my team over the last week to jumpstart negotiations and resolve the impasse that threatened thousands of Georgia jobs," Sen. @ossoff said. 
https://www.thecentersquare.com/georgia/sk-innovation-lg-energy-solutions-reach-agreement-save-2-600-georgia-jobs/article_912b9ac0-9ba5-11eb-b7ab-2b6e1040f5f9.html
@lalgarin27 @SenatorWarnock @ossoff Hi Luis, we're sorry to hear about these difficulties. Please reach out to our office at 470-786-7800 and ask for Neal; he'd be happy to help.

"GA is now positioned to be not just a national leader, but a global leader in the production of clean energy technology...this deal is going to attract other companies to invest in our state so that we can become truly a national leader in the clean energy sector." -Sen. @ossoff https://twitter.com/gpbnews/status/1381651201595482112 QT @gpbnews One of Georgia's largest economic development projects can move forward after two South Korean electric vehicle battery companies settled a trade secrets dispute over the weekend.
https://www.gpb.org/news/2021/04/12/georgia-leaders-cheer-settlement-allowing-battery-plant-construction-continue

RT @GeorgiaDemocrat “When the future of the plant was in jeopardy, Senator Ossoff provided leadership and helped us achieve a path forward,” said Jun Kim, the company’s chief executive.

Read how @ossoff worked to save a $2.6 billion project and 2,600 Georgia jobs. #gapol https://www.ajc.com/politics/politics-blog/how-bitter-korean-rivals-settled-a-rift-that-threatened-georgia-battery-plant/B7J76F3Q7NGJ5EUXVCMY2P2LOA/

RT @bluestein “This is Georgia’s economic future,” says Sen. Jon @Ossoff, who confirms he met with execs of the two rival Korean firms in the days before the last-minute agreement was struck. He says Biden called him Saturday afternoon to tell him the $2.6B project is moving forward. #gapol http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eyxwzv_XEAAcAAd.jpg

WATCH: Sen. @ossoff spoke with @FOX5Atlanta's @Ericperrytv about the decisive role he played in jumpstarting stalled negotiations between SK Innovation and LG Energy Solutions to secure a deal and save 2,600 Georgia jobs in Commerce. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EyveNc2XEAIySSx.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1381441345546424322/vid/480x270/yGDIefxvRIy6qiBm.mp4?tag=14

ICYMI: Yesterday, after stepping-in to jumpstart stalled negotiations between SK Innovation and LG Energy Solutions, Sen. @ossoff announced a deal to save an estimated 2,600 jobs in Commerce, Ga.

Read how he did it and what it means for Georgia's economy: https://www.ajc.com/politics/politics-blog/how-bitter-korean-rivals-settled-a-rift-that-threatened-georgia-battery-plant/B7J76F3Q7NGJ5EUXVCMY2P2LOA/
To all of our Muslim friends in Georgia & around the world: Ramadan Kareem! May this time be restorative & offer valuable reflection. #Ramadan

Last month, I secured a commitment from Polly Trottenberg to support good, clean energy jobs in GA. I’m looking forward to working alongside her as Deputy Secretary at @USDOT to advance work being done in Jackson County & across GA to improve our American infrastructure. https://twitter.com/SenatorWarnock/status/1367539301249150978 QT @SenatorWarnock I want to ensure companies with GA footprints will be leaders in greening our transportation infrastructure & providing good jobs. Yesterday, I was glad to secure a commitment from the nominee for Dep. Transportation Sec. ensuring support for keeping clean energy jobs in GA. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1367534498561327106/img/zf65IOh_MxEmjSa2.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1367534498561327106/vid/490x270/qKpJo4HYcaI06zSV.mp4?tag=14

As I’ve said before, I hope businesses, athletes & entertainers can protest GA’s unjust voter suppression law not by leaving but by joining us on the ground and fighting against it.

At the same time, we need federal voting rights protections—& that’s what I’m fighting for. https://twitter.com/bluestein/status/1381627708355010560 QT @bluestein Will Smith and the director Antoine Fuqua are pulling their upcoming film production “Emancipation” out of Georgia because of the state’s new voting law — the first major production to cite the law as a reason to leave the state #gapol https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/12/business/will-smith-emancipation-georgia.html

No matter where I am in Georgia, I always hear about the need for good, sustainable jobs, and the recent settlement between SK Innovation & LG Chem is going to help keep good-paying jobs local & allow us to lead the nation in greening our transportation infrastructure.

Today I'm praying for Daunte Wright & his family. I'm praying for the Minneapolis community that has experienced too much grief. I'm praying about how painful these deaths of Black Americans have been on all of us. 

Congress must act to help prevent these tragedies.

RT @maziehirono If my Republican colleagues have a better, stronger approach to combating anti-Asian hate crimes than the COVID-19 Hate Crimes Act – a modest, important step to #StopAsianHate – I'm all ears. Otherwise, stop making excuses and vote for the bill.

Today marks 100 day of the new Congress. In that time, @HouseDemocrats delivered COVID-19 relief, strengthened our unions, supported our Dreamers & much MORE.

RT @RepJamesComer Leading an outstanding @GOPoversight delegation to our southern border in El Paso, TX.

Our first stop: a border holding facility to meet with local law enforcement and talk solutions to the border crisis. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EyyXsPCWEAEJKzk.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EyyXsPDWQAEwYPU.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EyyXsPuWgAMQw2T.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EyyXsRzXIAktGkU.jpg
I will always work to ensure the well-being of veterans and their family members.

I had the pleasure of touring the Dwight D. Eisenhower Leavenworth VA Medical Center with Senator @JerryMoran and Secretary McDonough. Afterward, we discussed the importance of providing the best possible care and benefits to our amazing veterans, no matter where they live. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EyyZsRYWgAMwqX4.png http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EyyZt7YWYAAmvWu.png

This week, I will share my experiences with you at the border and tell the stories of what we saw on the ground, and what I believe needs to happen to get this humanitarian and national security crisis under control.

The Administration is doing nothing to stop the flow of illegal migrants crossing the border. Since VP Harris was tapped to lead the border response, she has not visited the border or held a single news conference to address the issue. This must stop. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EyzrjYyWgAYO532.jpg

This crisis is putting migrants in harm’s way, it is overwhelming Customs and Border Patrol agents, and it is empowering the Mexican cartels to continue the exploitation of children. This is a crisis.

Last week, I took a trip to the Southern Border, near McAllen, Texas to see the impacts of President Biden’s failed immigration policy.
 
What I saw was heartbreaking, angering, and is a full scale crisis.

To stop executive overreach, I introduced legislation requiring the President to notify Congress and the American public 30 days before issuing an executive order to better understand the order before implementation.

President Biden issued another executive order circumventing Congress and blatantly infringing on our 2nd Amendment rights. I will not stand for any violation of our law-abiding citizens’ rights to keep and bear arms. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EyybrYFWgAQkVZg.jpg

Glad to join my colleague @RepCawthorn in supporting legislation helping veterans transition into civilian life. https://twitter.com/RepCawthorn/status/1380277686275350532 QT @RepCawthorn I am proud to introduce the Veterans Fellowship Act, which empowers veterans in NC-11, and nation-wide to obtain a fulfilling career upon their re-entry into private life. 

Thank you to @RepMann @RepJimBanks @RepBarryMoore @RepTenney for joining me as original cosponsors! http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eye6izYWEAQVpXD.png

@CBP @TxDPS @HomelandGOP http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1381702952029671434/pu/img/cuKxxwNrF1dBPbn4.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1381702952029671434/pu/vid/320x568/yEkRxvSfwz4xA_Eu.mp4?tag=12

This is my second trip to the U.S.-Mexico border this year.

I can say, without a doubt, that what @CBP and @TxDPS officers are seeing every day is a crisis.

We must do more to address our broken immigration system and improve border security. @HomelandGOP https://twitter.com/HomelandGOP/status/1381598067279859714 QT @HomelandGOP .@HomelandGOP members joined @TxDPS special operations officers on their nightly routine responding to illegal activity along the border to better understand what they’re up against every day. There is no doubt there is a crisis at our southern border. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EyxqlQ7XEAINMON.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EyxrSzHXAAQP_R9.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EyxrkY3XEAEbnyt.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eyxr-c3XEAEteTq.jpg

The Biden border crisis is a stain on our nation.

I spoke on the Senate floor today on my recent trip to the souther border & the commonsense actions that the Biden Administration can take to address the problem at our southern border created by @POTUS's unilateral actions. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1381737905408839682/img/O9ahW7QGVmdd8rBr.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1381737905408839682/vid/480x270/K5Aq751-9njSHt36.mp4?tag=14

The lack of leadership on this crisis from the Biden-Harris administration is dangerous & unacceptable.
https://kilrradio.com/kirl-news/565556

Trillions in deficit spending -- using borrowed money -- should concern every American. Eventually, the Fed will have to raise interest rates, causing interest payments on national debt to skyrocket & risk sending us down a dangerous debt spiral. #IA04
https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/11/powell-says-its-highly-unlikely-the-fed-will-raise-rates-this-year-despite-stronger-economy.html

Chairman Powell said, “We can afford to wait to see actual inflation appear before we raise interest rates."

If we wait for inflation, it'll be too late.

➡️No se preguntará el estatus migratorio del fallecido. El solicitante debe tener un estatus legal
➡️No hay límite de ingresos para aplicar

Thank you all of you who support me.  

Soon I will be back.

And this time, I’ll be all in because my heart is no longer broken now that my Daddy has been set free. ❤️

Last night, the Mighty Hands that formed and created my Dad’s hands, and the wonderful man that my father is, lifted him up and took him home to heaven.

Today we rejoice that his pain is gone and he has been set free!

They took care of my mother and held her tight and loved her so..

But the greatest thing my father’s hands ever did was they taught me how to pray..

My Dad’s big strong hands put my tiny hands together when I was young and introduced me to God..

I watched his hands write, calculate, and carefully bid projects on all the many blueprints..

They typed, wrote, and published books..

They created inventions and that even got nominated for a Nobel Peace Prize..

They taught me how to drive a car, drive a boat, and sail a sailboat..

I watched his hands build amazing things with his tools..

Measure, snap a chalk line, cut, hammer all the nails in with one swing, climb the ladders, load the trucks..

My Dad had the strongest hands I’ve ever known.

They held me as a baby, carried me, swung me, threw me in the air, lifted me to ride on his shoulders..

They taught me to tie my shoes, ride a bike, throw, catch, and hit a ball, and fish..

He couldn’t finish school, but proudly went to work to support his family.

With only a truck and a ladder, he tirelessly worked and eventually built a thriving construction company that put a roof over our heads, fed us, clothed us, and Dad provided our families every need.

He was drafted at age 20 to go to war in Vietnam and served our country in the Navy.  He lost friends there just like many did.

He met a girl after his service, when he went back to college, married my Mom, and had a little girl named Marjorie.

My Dad grew up with very little, but with a faith in God and dreamed the Great American Dream.

He worked every job from riding a bike delivering newspapers, to factory work, to construction work, and all in between, while trying to go to school.

We don’t win every battle we fight, but my amazing father won the war, and he taught me how to withstand the greatest enemy.

My Dad was the forgotten American man that President Trump worked so hard for.

While I have endured the flaming arrows fired daily at me while I have been fighting against the left’s war on our freedoms in Congress, my soul was torn apart watching my Daddy suffer and slowly die with cancer.

My father passed away last night after a hard fought battle over the past 3 months with Melanoma.  

Most people don’t know how tremendously difficult my first three months of Congress have been. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eyzoa3_XEAM9hrR.jpg

RT @ChelseaCirruzzo This week is Black Maternal Health Week. Black women face the highest rates of maternal death in the U.S. In 2019, the rate of maternal death for Black women was 2.5 times that of white women, per a CDC report. This past year had marked some big action to improve maternal health.

April 11-17 is #BlackMaternalHealthWeek, a week where we center Black lives and Black bodies as we work to end the maternal health crisis.

#BlackLivesMatter, this week and every week.

I am proud to introduce the 4th Annual Black Maternal Health Week resolution with @CoryBooker, @RepUnderwood, and over 75 of our colleagues.

This #BlackMaternalHealthWeek, the message is clear: Black mamas can't wait. https://adams.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/reps-adams-underwood-sen-booker-introduce-black-maternal-health-week

President Biden has made strong selections, highlighting his commitment to addressing the real cyber risks facing our nation. In the months ahead, I look forward to working with the Administration to strengthen our cyberdefenses and protect the American people.

I’m also pleased that Jen Easterly – a key CSC contributor – will be nominated to lead the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency. Many of the CSC’s recommendations were focused on strengthening CISA; I know Jen has the knowledge and skills to accomplish that task.

It’s not too late for the General Assembly to establish an independent commission to draw district boundaries for both state legislative and Congressional districts. It’s the right thing to do, and it’s what the people of Illinois want.

The Governor has an obligation to the people of Illinois to keep that pledge and veto whatever map the General Assembly sends to his desk. There’s widespread, bipartisan agreement that politicians shouldn’t be able to pick their own voters.

Gov. Pritzker ran on a crystal clear commitment to veto any redistricting plan that was drawn by lawmakers. That is exactly the type of redistricting process we have happening right now, and the Governor has been AWOL on this issue since the public hearings began.

This morning, I joined @RepTimButler and Rep. @AveryBourne at the #IL State Capitol to talk about redistricting & @GovPritzker's pledge to veto any legislative map that is drawn by lawmakers.
